name: 李老师不是你老师
content: In March this year, the owner of a ZTO Express outlet in Ruzhou, Henan Province, was dissatisfied with the fine imposed by the headquarters and recorded a video of burning a package to show his resignation.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
On March 21, the School of Computer Science at Shandong University of Technology issued a "No Game Day" rule, requiring students to promise not to play games in the dormitory from Monday to Friday. If they do not sign, their parents will be required to sign a promise to take responsibility for the consequences of playing games. 
And it is not allowed to spread the news on the Internet platform

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On March 22, an online ride-hailing vehicle collided with a motorcycle at Hubei Academy of Fine Arts. It is suspected that the two parties had an argument at a breakfast shop.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: A university in Beijing notified that students from Hong Kong, Macau and Taiwan will no longer be exempted from ideological and political military training and military theory courses

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On March 22, in Dongguo Town, Zaozhuang, Shandong, the local government forcibly demolished residents' houses, and the residents knelt down and kowtowed to the leaders, begging them to let them go.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
March 21, Handan, Hebei. A user who claimed to be the uncle of Wang Ziyao, the victim of the Handan juvenile murder case, said, "Both numbers have been blocked. Yesterday, the telecommunications company came to our house and blocked our signal, fearing that we would send random calls. At this moment, there are at least 8 people on duty at the door of our house to prevent anyone from approaching."
A video showed several unidentified people standing outside Wang Ziyao's house.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On March 21, in Wuhan, Hubei, an armless man was asked to show his disability certificate in order to enjoy barrier-free passage when riding the subway, even though his hands were obviously disabled. In response, the subway customer service said that the current regulations require that relevant certificates must be presented for verification before barrier-free passage can be enjoyed.
